- Testing strategy

Jack called in as authentication module owner, though his recent changes haven't been deployed yet.

pullRequests.title: Implement JWT authentication for user sessions
pullRequests.body:
This PR implements JWT-based authentication to replace the current session-based approach.

## Changes
- Added JWT token generation and validation
- Updated login/logout endpoints
- Added middleware for token verification
- Basic error handling

## Notes
Still working on refresh token logic. Some edge cases may not be handled yet.

## Testing
Manual testing done, automated tests pending.

comments.body:
Thanks for getting this started Jack. A few initial observations:

1. The error handling in `validateToken()` could be more robust
2. Consider extracting the JWT configuration to environment variables
3. We need tests for the token refresh flow

Let's sync up tomorrow to discuss the approach.

Jack, I see some security concerns here:

- Token expiration is set to 24 hours, should be much shorter
- No rate limiting on token refresh endpoint
- JWT secret is hardcoded

Can you address these before we move forward?

Thanks for the feedback. Working on addressing the security issues. Having some trouble with the refresh token rotation - it's more complex than I initially thought. Might need some guidance on the pattern we want to use.
Jack, this has been open for 2 weeks now. Can we schedule a pairing session to get this unblocked? The authentication work is holding up other team members.

pullRequests.title: Fix user profile validation logic
pullRequests.body:
Quick fix for profile validation that was causing registration failures.

## Problem
Users with special characters in names couldn't register.

## Solution
Updated regex pattern to allow more characters.

## Testing
Tested manually with various name formats.

comments.body: This looks good! I was actually running into this issue yesterday. Thanks for the fix.

commit.message:
WIP: JWT authentication implementation

Starting work on JWT tokens. Basic structure in place but refresh logic still needs work.

Add JWT token validation middleware

Added middleware to validate JWT tokens on protected routes. Error handling is basic for now.

Update token expiration logic

Trying to implement refresh token rotation but getting confused by the flow. Committing current progress.

Fix profile validation regex

Users with apostrophes in names (like O'Connor) couldn't register. Updated pattern.

issues.title: JWT token refresh endpoint returns 500 error
issues.body:
The `/auth/refresh` endpoint is throwing a 500 error when trying to refresh tokens.

## Steps to reproduce
1. Login and get initial token
2. Wait for token to expire
3. Call refresh endpoint with refresh token
4. Gets 500 error

## Expected
Should return new access token

## Actual
Server error 500

## Stack trace
```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of undefined
    at refreshToken (/src/auth/token.js:45)
    at ...
```

comments.body: Looking into this. I think the issue is in how I'm parsing the refresh token payload. The user lookup is failing.
Still debugging this. The token validation is working but there's something wrong with the database query. Might need help from someone more familiar with our ORM.
Jack, this is blocking QA testing. Can we pair on this tomorrow morning?

stories.description:
Replace current session-based authentication with JWT tokens to improve scalability and support for microservices architecture.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] JWT token generation on login
- [ ] Token validation middleware
- [ ] Refresh token rotation
- [ ] Secure token storage recommendations
- [ ] Migration path from current sessions

## Technical Notes
- Use RS256 for signing
- Tokens expire in 15 minutes
- Refresh tokens expire in 7 days
- Support for token revocation

comments.author: jack.thompson
comments.body: Started implementation. Created initial PR #234. Basic token generation is working but refresh logic is more complex than expected.

comments.author: sarah.chen
comments.body: Jack, we're approaching the due date. What's the current blocker? Do you need additional support or should we consider reducing scope?

comments.author: jack.thompson
comments.body: Main blocker is the refresh token rotation. I understand the concept but struggling with the implementation details. Also running into some edge cases with concurrent requests.

comments.author: mike.rodriguez
comments.body: Jack, I can help with the architecture design. Let's schedule a deep dive session to clarify the approach.

comments.author: jack.thompson
comments.body: Thanks Mike, that session helped a lot. Still working through implementation but have a clearer path forward now.

stories.description:
Fix validation logic that prevents users with certain special characters in their names from registering.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [x] Support apostrophes in names (O'Connor, D'Angelo)
- [x] Support hyphens (Mary-Jane, Jean-Luc) 
- [x] Support accented characters (José, François)
- [x] Update tests to cover edge cases

## Impact
~5% of registration attempts are failing due to overly strict validation.

Design the architecture for the new identity verification microservice that will handle document verification, biometric matching, and risk assessment.

## Scope
- Database schema design
- API contract definition
- Security and compliance requirements
- Integration with existing platform
- Scalability considerations

## Dependencies
- Requires completion of JWT authentication (IDP-145)
- Legal review of data retention policies

comments.author: mike.rodriguez
comments.body: Jack, this is a big architectural piece. We should start with a design doc before jumping into implementation. I'm available to pair on the initial architecture if needed.

bugs.description:
The JWT token refresh endpoint is throwing internal server errors when attempting to refresh expired tokens.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Login to get initial access/refresh token pair
2. Wait for access token to expire (15 minutes)
3. Call POST /auth/refresh with refresh token
4. Observe 500 error response

## Expected Result
Should return new access token and optionally rotated refresh token

## Actual Result
HTTP 500 Internal Server Error

## Error Details
```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of undefined
    at refreshToken (/src/auth/token.js:45)
    at /src/routes/auth.js:67
```

## Environment
- Development environment
- Node.js v18.17.0
- JWT library v9.0.2

comments.author: jack.thompson
comments.body: I can reproduce this locally. The issue seems to be in the user lookup when validating the refresh token. Investigating...

comments.author: jack.thompson
comments.body: Found the issue - I'm not properly handling the case where the refresh token payload doesn't contain the expected user ID structure. Working on a fix.

comments.author: qa.team
comments.body: This is blocking our testing of the authentication flow. What's the ETA on the fix?
